{{distinguish|text=the modern-day [[Italian Republic]]}} {{refimprove|date=March 2011}} {{Infobox Former Country |native_name = ''Repubblica Italiana'' |conventional_long_name = Italian Republic |common_name = Italy |continent = Europe |region = Italy |country = Italy |common_languages = [[Italian language|Italian]] |religion = [[Roman Catholic]] |era = Napoleonic Wars |status = [[Sister Republic]] of [[Napoleonic France]] |year_start = 1802 |date_start = 26 January |event_start = National Meetings in [[Lyon]] |date_pre = 9 February 1801 |event_pre = [[Treaty of Lunéville]] |year_end = 1805 |date_end = 17 March |event_end = [[Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic)|Monarchy]] proclaimed |p1=Kingdom of Italy (Holy Roman Empire) |flag_p1 = Banner of the Holy Roman Emperor with haloes (1400-1806).svg |p2=Cisalpine Republic |flag_p2 =Flag of the Repubblica Cisalpina.svg |p3=Subalpine Republic |flag_p3 = Flag of the Repubblic of Alba.svg |s1 = Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic) |flag_s1 = Flag of the Napoleonic Kingdom of Italy.svg |image_flag = Flag of the Italian Republic (1802).svg |image_coat = Flag of the Italian Republic (1802).svg |image_map = Italy 1803.jpg |image_map_caption = Northern Italy in 1803
(borders between Italy and France are not accurate) |currency = [[Milanese scudo]], [[lira]], [[soldo]] and [[French denier|denaro]] |capital = Milan |latd=45 |latm=28 |latNS=N |longd=9 |longm=10 |longEW=E |government_type = Constitutional republic |title_leader = [[President of Italy|President]] |leader1 = [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] |year_leader1 = 1802–1805 |title_deputy = [[Vice President]] |deputy1 = [[Francesco Melzi d'Eril]] |year_deputy1 = 1802–1805 |legislature = [[Legislative Body]] }} The '''Italian Republic''' ({{lang-it|'''Repubblica Italiana'''}}) was a short-lived (1802–1805) [[republic]] located in [[Northern Italy]]. [[Napoleon]] served as [[President]] and its capital was [[Milan]]. ==The republic== [[File:MonsiauConsultaRepubliqueCsalpine1808.jpg|thumb|left|250px|The ''[[Consulte de Lyon|Consulta of the République cisalpine]]'' receives the [[Napoleon|First Consul]], 26 January 1802, [[Nicolas-André Monsiau]], 1806–08]] The Italian Republic was the successor of the [[Cisalpine Republic]], which changed its constitution to allow the French [[First Consul]] Napoleon to become its president. The new constitution changed the name of the state to the "Italian Republic"; it consisted of the same areas that had comprised the Cisalpine Republic, primarily [[Lombardy]] and [[Romagna]]. The republic had a territory of more than {{convert|42,500|km2|sqmi|sp=us}}, and a population of 3,240,000 in 12 ''[[département]]s''. [[Milan]] was the capital city, the main center having 124,000 inhabitants in 1764. The country was prosperous despite the plundering experienced in preceding centuries. Its economy was based on [[cereal]] [[agriculture]] and [[cattle|cattling]], plus flourishing small industries, notably the production of [[silk]]. The flag of the Italian Republic maintained the three Italian-Milanese [[national colours]], but with a new, less revolutionary, pattern. The coat of arms was specified in a decree on May 13, 1802. A treaty of friendship and commerce with the [[Republic of San Marino]] was signed on June 10, 1802, the Concordat with the [[Holy See]] on September 16, 1803. The government created the [[Carabinieri|National Guard]] of Italy, a National [[Gendarmerie]], and a [[Guardia di Finanza|finance police]]; the [[metric system]] was introduced and a national currency was planned, although never minted during the republican era. In 1805, following Bonaparte's assumption of the title of Emperor of the French, the Italian Republic was transformed into the [[Kingdom of Italy (Napoleonic)|Kingdom of Italy]] (''Regno d'Italia''), with Napoleon as king and his stepson [[Eugène de Beauharnais]] as [[viceroy]]. ==Institutional form== According to the Italian constitution of 1802, sovereignty resided in three electoral colleges of three to two hundred members: the College of Owners (''il Collegio dei possidenti''), the College of Scholars (''il Collegio dei dotti''), and the College of Traders (''il Collegio dei mercanti''), the first having its seat in [[Milan]], the second in [[Bologna]], and the third in [[Brescia]]. All the colleges elected a commission of control and supreme rule, called the Censorship (''la Censura''), composed of twenty-one members and based in [[Cremona]]. [[File:Melzi.jpg|thumb|right|250px|The Vice-President of Italy, citizen [[Francesco Melzi d'Eril]]]] The head of state was the president of the republic (''il Presidente della repubblica''), [[Napoleon Bonaparte]], elected for 10 years. The president had full executive powers, appointed the vice-president (''il Vicepresidente'') and the secretary of state, took legislative and diplomatic initiative, chose the ministers, public agents, ambassadors, and chiefs of the army, summoned the executive councils, and prepared the budget. The vice-president, [[Francesco Melzi d'Eril]], acted for the president during his absence. Melzi was described as a gentleman, and effectively ruled over the state's domestic affairs during the three years of the republic's life. Never submitting to Napoleon, Melzi was demoted after the monarchy's proclamation in favour of more controllable men; however, Melzi's character ensured him Napoleon's deep private respect during all the years of the French empire. Melzi also introduced obligatory conscription to Italy. The Consulta (''la Consulta di Stato'') was a commission of eight members led by the president of the republic and in charge of foreign policy. The commissioners were appointed by the Censorship upon nomination by the three colleges: many former members of the [[Directory (political)|Directory]] of the [[Cisalpine Republic]] entered into office. The Consulta ratified treaties, approved any special decrees concerning state security, and in the event of the death or resignation of the president, appointed the successor. The minister of foreign affairs was chosen from among the commissioners. The Legislative Council (''il Consiglio legislativo'') was a commission of at least ten members appointed by the president for three years. Its mission was to allow the president to submit legislation, helping him in the elaboration of laws and being present when they were discussed in parliament. The secretary of state (''il segretario di Stato'') was the chief of the public administration. He promulgated the laws, guarded the state's seal, and countersigned presidential acts. The first secretary was Diego Guicciardi, soon followed by Pellegrino Nobili and, finally, by Luigi Vaccari. The government comprised seven ministers (''i ministri''). The [[Minister of War]] was at first Alessandro Trivulzi and then, from 1804, General Domenico Pino; [[Minister of Interior]] was at first [[Luigi Villa]] and then, from 1803, Daniele Felici; [[Minister of Foreign Affairs]] was [[Ferdinando Marescalchi]]; [[Minister of Justice]] and Great Judge was Bonaventura Spannocchi; [[Minister of Finance|Minister of Treasury]] was Antonio Veneri; [[Minister of Finance]] was [[Giuseppe Prina]]; [[Minister of Worship (France)|Minister of Religion]] was [[Giovanni Bovara]]. To draw up its budgets, the government was assisted by a Commissionership for National Accountancy. The parliament of the republic was the Legislative Body (''il Corpo Legislativo'') with limited powers. It was composed of 75 members elected in each department by the three colleges. It was summoned by the president of the republic and could only approve or reject a law, the discussion being reserved to a more restricted Chamber of orators or Chamber of speakers (''Camera degli oratori'', a committee of fifteen speakers). First appointed at the Meetings of Lyon, one third of the parliament had to be renewed every two years. The tribunals were divided into tribunals of first instance (''tribunali di prima istanza''), courts of appeal (''corti d'appello''), courts of revision (''corti di revisione''), and a court of cassation (''corte di cassazione''). The judges of the first two were appointed by the Consulta, the latter two by the three colleges. ==Local administration== Following the French system, The state was divided into 12 ''[[départements]]'' (''[[départements|dipartimenti]]''). The chief of the department was the [[prefect]] (''[[prefetto]]''), an office created on May 6, 1802. The prefect was the state's representative in each province (dipartimento), and had two main functions: the first was to implement the administrative decisions of the central government and to control the local authorities, the second was leadership of the police. The local legislative body was the [[General councils (France)|General Council]] (''Consiglio generale''), composed of representatives of the communes. The government appointed the Central Departmental Administration (''Consiglio della prefettura''), composed of five or seven members chosen from nominations submitted by the General Council: the Administrations had powers over taxes and public works and, generally, represented local interests. The departments were divided into districts (''distretti'') equivalent to the French ''[[arrondissements]]''. The chief of the district was the vice-prefect, which had powers similar to those of the prefect, but for a smaller area. However, the structure of the districts was not uniform over all the territory of the republic, and some districts were administered by a district council and a chancellor. The districts were divided into ''[[Communes of Italy|communes]]''. Communes with more than 3,000 inhabitants had a [[city council]] (''[[municipal council|consiglio comunale]]'') of thirty or forty members, chosen by the General council from nominations submitted by the same city council. In the smaller communes, all the taxable citizens were councillors. The council elected a municipality{{cfn|date=July 2018}} of three to nine members, helped in its executive functions by a city secretary. All city offices were held only by owners and traders, and the leadership of the owners was assured. Each commune had a tax collector. ===List of departments and districts=== * [[Department of Agogna|Agogna]] (capital [[Novara]]) ** [[District of Novara]], [[District of Vigevano]], [[District of Domodossola]], [[District of Varallo]], [[District of Arona]] * Crostolo (capital [[Reggio Emilia]]) * [[Department of Lario|Lario]] (capital [[Como]]) ** [[District of Como]], [[District of Varese]], [[District of Sondrio]], [[District of Lecco]] * Lower Po (capital [[Ferrara]]) * [[Department of Mella|Mella]] (capital [[Brescia]]) ** [[District of Brescia]], [[District of Chiari]], [[District of Verolanuova]], [[District of Salò]] * [[Department of Mincio|Mincio]] (capital [[Mantua]]) ** [[District of Mantua]], [[District of Revere]], [[District of Verona]], [[District of Castiglione]] * [[Department of Olona|Olona]] (capital [[Milan]]) ** [[District of Milan]], [[District of Pavia]], [[District of Monza]], [[District of Gallarate]] * Panaro (capital [[Modena]]) * Reno (capital [[Bologna]]) * Rubicone (capital [[Cesena]]) * [[Department of Serio|Serio]] (capital [[Bergamo]]) ** [[District of Bergamo]], [[District of Clusone]], [[District of Treviglio]], [[District of Breno]] {{Short description|American artist}} {{Infobox person |name = Ivy Supersonic |image = |caption = Ivy Supersonic |birth_name = Ivy Silberstein |birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1967|6|14}} |birth_place = [[New York City]] |occupation = Fashion Designer
Entertainer
Animated Character Creator |death_date = |death_place = |years_active = |retired = }} '''Ivy Supersonic''' (born '''Ivy Silberstein''' on June 12, 1967) is a [[New York City]] fashion designer, self-promoter, event planner, and animated character designer.{{cite news|title=No: 1643 Ivy Supersonic|publisher=The Guardian (London)|date=May 26, 2000}} She is the daughter of [[Jerome Silberstein]], founder of Silberstein, Awad & Miklos.[http://www.ivysupersonic.com/oct24pr.html Infamous Medical Malpractice Attorney Jerome D. Silberstein Brutally Mutilated By Malpractice] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060618183349/http://www.ivysupersonic.com/oct24pr.html |date=2006-06-18 }} She also paints under her own name. ==Fashion and promotion== Supersonic is a graduate of the [[Fashion Institute of Technology]]. She launched the denim brand I.B.I.V. during her university student years. Within three months of their launch, the jeans were featured on the cover of ''[[Women's Wear Daily]]'', have also been featured on [[MTV]], ''[[Beverly Hills, 90210]]'' and ''[[Good Morning America]]''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} She has designed hats for [[Pamela Anderson]],{{cite news|title=Tommy Lee's Latest Love|work=New York Post|date=July 23, 2002}} [[Carmen Electra]], [[Snoop Dogg]],{{cite news|title=Note Worthy|work=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel|date=September 14, 2001}} and [[George Clinton (funk musician)|George Clinton]], among others.{{cite news|first=George|last=Rush|title=Liam Finds Oasis in Ivy League|work=Daily News|location=New York|date=June 20, 2000}}[http://www.ivysupersonic.com/hats/ IVY Supersonic - HATS Collection & Gallery] [[Reality television|Reality TV]] star [[Omarosa Manigault]] wore a hat designed by Ivy on the season finale of'' [[The Apprentice (U.S. TV series)|The Apprentice]]''.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} Supersonic has held parties for ''Mira! Magazine'' and adult actress [[Gina Lynn]].{{cite news|title=Simmons In All-Night Prowl|work=The New York Post|date=July 14, 2001}} She had a cartoon character of herself tattooed on her by [[Kat Von D]] for the TV show ''[[Miami Ink]]''. She originated the Ivy Supersonic cartoon at Universal Music Group, but bought it back in 2002, when Universal had a high staff turn over.[http://www.prwebdirect.com/releases/2006/10/prweb445793.htm PR: Miami Ink TV Commercial with Ivy Supersonic] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061114040835/http://www.prwebdirect.com/releases/2006/10/prweb445793.htm |date=2006-11-14 }} Ivy had 17 tattoos done in 30 days to protest the Sqrat case. ==Feuds, provocations and incidents== ===Sqrat=== In one of her many "public feuds" Ivy claims that the idea for the character [[Scrat]] from the movie ''[[Ice Age (2002 film)|Ice Age]]'' was stolen from her after she pitched her character ''Sqrat'', a cross between a [[squirrel]] and a [[rat]] that she claims to have seen in Madison Square Park to [[20th Century Fox]] movie executives. Ivy claims she created the character in 1999 and has the trademark to prove it. A [[CNN]] report by [[Jeanie Moos]] of Ivy claims was aired in 2000, two years before ''Ice Age'' went into development.[http://www.ivysupersonic.com/ivid/cnn2000.shtml Videos on IvySupersonic.com] Ivy claims she was offered a $300,000 settlement by Fox but turned it down, and subsequently lost the case at both the trial and appellate level.242 Fed. Appx. 720 (2d Cir. 2007) Ivy has continued her "Make Rupert Murdoch Pay" campaign in hopes of still receiving damages for her perceived infringement. ===Plumm Nightclub=== On October 27, 2007, Ivy started another public feud with New York nightclub, Plumm, over $1000. Ivy claims she is owed for a party she claims she hosted at the nightclub. Supersonic admitted to defacing the club after Plumm refused to pay her the money she claimed to be owed. Supersonic faced felony vandalism charges, but through a plea did minimal jail time and community service.{{cite news|first=David|last=Foxley|title=Ivy Supersonic Update|publisher=New York Observer|url=http://www.observer.com/2007/ivy-supersonic-update|date=November 12, 2007|accessdate=2007-12-08|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071217051607/http://www.observer.com/2007/ivy-supersonic-update|archivedate=December 17, 2007|df=}}{{cite news|title=Ivy Supersonic: 'I Don't Want to Go to Jail I'm 95 lbs'|url=http://www.mediabistro.com/fishbowlny/pop_culture/ivy_supersonic_i_donat_want_to_go_to_jail_im_95_lbs_71085.asp|date=November 14, 2007|accessdate=2007-12-01}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ===''The Tyra Banks Show''=== Supersonic was thrown off ''[[The Tyra Banks Show]]'' on October 26, 2007, after producers did not like her tattoos showing through her dress. Ivy was given a shirt to cover the tattoos up but instead ripped the shirt and threw it on the floor and was subsequently asked to leave.{{cite news|first=Richard|last=Johnson|title=Tattoos Get Tyra Bounced|publisher=New York Daily News|url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/10282007/gossip/pagesix/tattoos_get_tyra_bounced.htm|date=October 28, 2007|accessdate=2007-12-01|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071224162655/http://www.nypost.com/seven/10282007/gossip/pagesix/tattoos_get_tyra_bounced.htm|archivedate=December 24, 2007|df=}}{{cite news|title=Supermodel thrown off Banks' show|publisher=Indo-Asian News Service|date=October 29, 2007}}{{cite news|title=Tabloid Tidbits|publisher=msnbc.com|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21518413/|date=October 29, 2007|accessdate=2007-12-01}} ===Bernie Madoff=== In 2009 she was summonsed after sneaking a recording device into the sentencing portion of the trial of infamous financier [[Bernie Madoff]].http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/howard-stern-wack-packer-ivy-supersonic-bellevue-police-article-1.401560 In the act she was arrested by the [[Federal Protective Service (United States)|Federal Protective Service]].http://www.businessinsider.com/how-howard-stern-tried-to-hack-the-madoff-sentencing-2009-7 ==Subsequent years== Ivy Supersonic does not appear to have been publicly visible during the 2010s. Her website was still up as of 2017 but its news page had no entries past 2009.http://ivysmedia.com/gallery2/main.php?g2_page=3 However in 2017 as Ivy Silberstein she had a show of her artwork, particularly her watercolors, in Manhattan.https://m.huffpost.com/us/entry/us_58f4ef23e4b015669722514e ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{imdb name|id=0839473|name=Ivy Supersonic}} *[http://www.ivysupersonic.com/ Ivy's Official Homepage] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Supersonic, Ivy}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American fashion designers]] [[Category:Fashion Institute of Technology alumni]] [[Category:Event planners]] [[Category:American painters]]

{{Infobox film | name = Joker | image = Joker 2012 poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Shirish Kunder]] | producer = {{plainlist| *[[Farah Khan]] *[[Akshay Kumar]] }} | writer = [[Shirish Kunder]] | starring = {{plainlist| *[[Akshay Kumar]] *[[Sonakshi Sinha]] *[[Minisha Lamba]] *[[Shreyas Talpade]] }} | music = {{plainlist| *[[G. V. Prakash Kumar]] *[[Gaurav Dagaonkar]] }} | cinematography = [[Sudeep Chatterjee]] | editing = Shirish Kunder | studio = [[Three's Company]] | distributor = {{plainlist| *[[Hari Om Entertainment]] *[[UTV Motion Pictures]] }} | released = {{Film date|2012|08|31|df=yes|ref1=<ref name="release"/>}} | runtime = 103 minutes<ref name=Runtime>{{cite web|title=''Joker'' (PG)|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/joker-2012-1|work=[[British Board of Film Classification]]|accessdate=27 December 2012}}</ref> | country = India | language = Hindi | budget = {{INRConvert|470|m}} | gross = {{INRConvert|200|m}}(domestic nett)<ref>http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4873&nCat=</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4856&nCat= |title=Joker Second Day Business |date=2 September 2012 |work=bosofficeindia.com}}</ref> }}
'''''Joker''''' is a 2012 [[Hindi]] [[comedy science fiction]] film directed by [[Shirish Kunder]] and also his second directorial venture after ''[[Jaan-E-Mann]]''.<ref name="indianexpress"/> The film stars [[Akshay Kumar]] opposite [[Sonakshi Sinha]] in lead roles. This was the second film in which Sinha paired opposite Kumar after ''[[Rowdy Rathore]]'' (2012). The film released worldwide on 31 August 2012, and received mixed to negative response upon release. The film was flopped at the box office .<ref name="release">{{cite web|title=Joker release date confirmed, to arrive on 14th September, 2012 |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2011/10/29/16564/index.html |work=29 October 2011 |publisher=[[Bollywood Hungama]] |accessdate=29 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2012/jul/090712-Joker-trailer-to-release-with-Cocktail.htm/ |title='Joker' trailer to release with 'Cocktail' |date=9 July 2012 |work=mid-day.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/bollywood/akki%E2%80%99s-back-game-842 |title=Akki's back in the game |date=19 September 2012 |work=Deccan Chronicle |accessdate=19 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120922111521/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/bollywood/akki%E2%80%99s-back-game-842 |archivedate=22 September 2012 |df= }}name="swingerjack">{{cite web|title=Worst movie of 2013 |author=IMDB |date=1 September 2012 |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1918886/ }}</ref> The trailer of the film revealed on 11 July 2012, and also in cinemas along with ''[[Cocktail (2012 film)|Cocktail]]''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.washingtonbanglaradio.com/content/101348210-indian-cinema-gets-3d-bandwagon-after-sohan-roys-dam-999-farah-khans-joker-be-2nd-# |title=Indian Cinema gets on 3D Bandwagon: After Sohan Roy's DAM 999, Farah Khan's JOKER to be the 2nd Bollywood 3D Movie |date=28 October 2010 |work=Washington Bangla Radio |accessdate=29 January 2011}}</ref>
==Plot== Agastya ([[Akshay Kumar]]) is a scientist, working on the development of a communication system, to communicate with aliens. But Agastya loses the faith of his seniors and is allotted with a deadline of one month to conclude his project with some substantial results.
In the mean time Agastya is informed by his girlfriend Diva ([[Sonakshi Sinha]]) about his father's illness. On hearing this they both reaches his native village Paglapur, whose colourful inhabitants include a man who speaks in gibberish, another who thinks he is a lamp post and everyone else who think that the World War II is still going on.
Soon after reaching there, Agastya finds that he was called on a false pretext of illness by his father.
On getting apprised about truth, Agastya decides to move back to US, but after hearing the plight of the inhabitants of Paglapur, due to the brushing aside of the village by the government because of its being absent from the demarcated map of India, he makes his mind to come out with some solution for the problem.
As the story proceeds, Agastya comes up with a quaint idea pertaining to the crop circle and arrival of aliens in his village, in order to fetch a recognition for his otherwise isolated village undergoing a plight of neglect ever since the independence.
With frames moving ahead, Agastya along with other villagers creates crop circle in Paglapur and spreads rumour about arrival of aliens in the village. And from there, amid tremendous media hype, takes over some hilarious sequences knitted around UFO and fictitious man made aliens.
In the end, the whole joke about the fake aliens is found out and at the end of the movie real aliens come and give the village the gift of oil.
==Cast== * [[Akshay Kumar]] as Agastya * [[Sonakshi Sinha]] as Diva * [[Shreyas Talpade]] as Babban * [[Minisha Lamba]] as News Reporter * [[Gurpreet Ghuggi]] as Bobby * [[Darshan Jariwala]] as Baba (Agastya's father) * [[Asrani]] as Guruji * [[Sanjai Mishra]] as Rajaji * [[Vindu Dara Singh]] as Sundi * [[Pitobash]] as Kachua * [[Alexx ONell]] as Simon<ref name="alexx">{{cite news|title=Alexx O'Nell in Shirish Kunder's 'Joker' |author=IANS | date= 12 April 2011 |work=The Times of India|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tv-/Alexx-ONell-in-Shirish-Kunders-Joker/articleshow/7959214.cms|accessdate=20 April 2011}}</ref> * [[Chitrangda Singh]] in Special appearance in song "Kafirana" * [[Farah Khan]] in a Guest Appearance * [[Vrajesh Hirjee]] as villager * [[Aarya Babbar]] as Majnu Tangewala (cameo)<ref>{{cite web | url=https://in.news.yahoo.com/meet-jokers-majnu-tangewala-050047080.html | title=Meet JOKER's 'Majnu Tangewala'! | publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] | work=[[Yahoo!|Yahoo! desk]] | date=28 January 2012 | accessdate=16 February 2016}}</ref>
==Production==
===Development=== [[Shirish Kunder]] had the project in development for several years before finding financial backing and hit films, and had to negotiate for use of the specific title which Kunder stated is important to the script itself.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sawfnews.com/bollywood/64941.aspx |title=Akshay Kumar in Shirish Kunder's Joker |date=15 August 2010 |work=Sawf News |accessdate=30 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100818215353/http://www.sawfnews.com/Bollywood/64941.aspx |archivedate=18 August 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The film is being produced by [[Farah Khan]], Shirish Kunder, and Akshay Kumar under the banner of Three's Company and [[Hari Om Entertainment]].<ref name="ndtv">{{cite web |title=Sonakshi To Do Item Number in Joker |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_story.aspx?keyword=bollywood&ID=ENTEN20110169352&subcatg=MOVIESINDIA&nid=85174 |publisher=NDTV |accessdate=13 February 2011 |work=Press Trust of India |date=10 February 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110714161809/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_story.aspx?keyword=bollywood&ID=ENTEN20110169352&subcatg=MOVIESINDIA&nid=85174 |archivedate=14 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The film was shot in 3D using 3D cameras, however in June 2012, it was announced that the film was no longer in 3D any more, since [[Ra.One]] and [[Don 2]] have taken the goals, if ''Joker'' flopped it would be a loss on the whole crew, therefore the film will only be released in 2D format.<ref name="indianexpress">{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/akshays-joker-will-be-first-fullfledged-3d-film/703251/0 |title=Akshay's 'Joker' will be first full-fledged 3D film |date=27 October 2010 |work=[[Indian Express]] |accessdate=29 January 2011}}</ref> According to director, Shirish Kunder, "It is an underdog story about how individuals make it big in life and in the process, get help from aliens from a fictional planet".<ref>{{cite web |title=I don't get Farah's cinema: Shirish Kunder |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/I-don-t-get-Farah-s-cinema-Shirish-Kunder/H1-Article1-674558.aspx |accessdate=19 March 2011 |date=17 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110320014441/http://www.hindustantimes.com/i-don-t-get-farah-s-cinema-shirish-kunder/h1-article1-674558.aspx |archivedate=20 March 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> [[Shreyas Talpade]] will play Akshay's brother in the film.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shreyas to play Akshay's brother in 'Joker' |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shreyas-to-play-akshays-brother-in-joker/140037-8-66.html |publisher=IBNLive |accessdate=13 February 2011 |work=IANS |date=10 January 2011}}</ref> Female lead opposite to Shreyas will be played by [[Minisha Lamba]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Minissha Lamba joins Joker |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2011/02/02/15296/index.html |publisher=Bollywood Hungama |accessdate=13 February 2011 |first=Joginder |last=Tuteja |date=2 February 2011}}</ref> who will enact the role of an innocent TV reporter.<ref>{{cite web |title=Minissha to play innocent TV reporter in Joker |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Minissha-to-play-innocent-TV-reporter-in-Joker/H1-Article1-675924.aspx |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130125064643/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Minissha-to-play-innocent-TV-reporter-in-Joker/H1-Article1-675924.aspx |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 January 2013 |accessdate=22 March 2011 |date=21 March 2011 }}</ref> Sonakshi will also perform an item number in the film.<ref name="ndtv"/> American actor [[Alexx ONell]] was also signed to play a role in the film.<ref name="alexx"/>
===Filming=== The first schedule of shooting was initially slated to take place in [[Ludhiana]], however the location was changed to [[Chandigarh]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Shirish to begin shooting for ''Joker'' in Chandigarh |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/generalnewsfeed/news/shirish-to-begin-shooting-for-joker-in-chandigarh/558796.html |publisher=IBN Live |accessdate=20 April 2011 |work=PTI| date=31 January 2011}}</ref> The shooting began on 14 February 2011 in Chandigarh.<ref name="schedule2">{{cite web |title=Akshay Kumar, Sonakshi Sinha's Joker Second Schedule Starts in May |url=http://bolly.sawfnews.com/NewsItem.aspx?id=66721 |publisher=Sawf News |accessdate=20 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110513160049/http://bolly.sawfnews.com/Newsitem.aspx?id=66721 |archivedate=13 May 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Shirish Kunder to begin shooting Joker from 12 February |url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=17581 |publisher=Business of Cinema |accessdate=20 April 2011 |date=11 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120324232427/http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=17581 |archivedate=24 March 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Are you ready for this Joker? |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-what-bollywood-stars-are-tweeting/20110202.htm |publisher=Rediff |accessdate=13 February 2011 |date=2 February 2011}}</ref> The crew finished the 19-day schedule on 12 March 2011, finishing 40% of the production work.<ref name="schedule1">{{cite web |title=Akshay Kumar & Sonakshi Sinha starrer Joker 40% complete |url=http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=17914 |publisher=Business of Cinema |accessdate=20 April 2011 |first=Manisha Pradhan |last=Singh |date=15 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110316054411/http://www.businessofcinema.com/news.php?newsid=17914 |archivedate=16 March 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The second schedule started on 17 May 2011 in [[Mumbai]]<ref name="schedule2"/> and concluded in June 2011.<ref>{{cite web|last=Aikara |first=Anita |title=Star Diary |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/Star-Diary/800966/ |work=[[The Indian Express]] |accessdate=19 July 2011 |date=10 June 2011}}</ref> The film is now slated to release on 31 August 2012. The theatrical trailer was released on [[UTV Motion Pictures]]' YouTube channel on 11 July 2012 only online. Whilst it released worldwide on television on 13 July 2012, and also in cinemas along with ''[[Cocktail (2012 film)|Cocktail]]''.
===Casting=== [[Shrish Kunder]] wanted to cast [[Asin Thottumkal]] as the female lead but, she was not able to adjust the dates for the film so, producers cast [[Sonakshi Sinha]] opposite [[Akshay Kumar]]. [[Shreyas Talpade]] and [[Minisha Lamba]] were later cast in pivotol roles.
==Reception== ''Joker'' received negative reviews from critics. Based on 16 reviews, review aggregate site ''desimartini.com'' gave the film the verdict, "Apart from an interesting concept and a handful of funny moments, ''Joker'' is drag and doesn't work as a comedy or as a sci-fi caper. Skip it!" The site's average audience rating is 2/5.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.desimartini.com/movies/joker/md1109.htm |title=Joker reviews |publisher=desimartini |accessdate=1 September 2012}}</ref> Independent Bollywood gave 2.5 out of 5 stars and said "A Funny and weird entertainer with message".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://independentbollywood.com/movie-reviews/joker-movie-review/123.html |title=Joker Movie Review |publisher=Independent Bollywood |accessdate=2 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120904040957/http://independentbollywood.com/movie-reviews/joker-movie-review/123.html |archivedate=4 September 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Soumyadipta Banerjee of In.com gave 0.5 out of 5 stars and said "Not only that the aliens are weird, the whole movie seems be in some weird planet after a point of time".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.in.com/news/entertainment/joker-is-just-weird-50134270-in-1.html |title=Joker is just weird! |publisher=In.com |accessdate=14 September 2012}}</ref> Saibal Chatterjee of ''[[NDTV]]Movies.com'' gave the film 1 out of 5 stars and wrote, "''Joker'' is a crude joke of a film that will leave you in tears unless you have a stomach strong enough to digest such unmitigated junk."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_Review.aspx?id=741 |title=Saibal Chatterjee's review of Joker |publisher=NDTVMovies.com |accessdate=1 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120902212556/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_Review.aspx?id=741 |archivedate=2 September 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Noted film critic [[Taran Adarsh]] also gave it 1 out of 5 stars and labelled it as a complete "disaster" and a "joke of a film".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/criticreview/id/504775 |title=Joker (2012) Hindi Movie Critic Review |first=Taran |last=Adarsh |work=Bollywood Hungama}}</ref>. [[IMDB]] also gave it 2.6/10 star.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1918886/ |title=Joker (2012) |}}</ref>
==Music== {{Infobox album | name = Joker | type = Soundtrack | artist = Chandan, Ashraf & Gaurav | cover = Poster_of_joker(2012_film).jpg | border = yes | alt = | released = {{Start date|df=y|2012|07|28}} | recorded = 2011 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Film soundtrack]] | length = | language = Hindi | label = [[Sony Music]] | producer = G. V. Prakash Kumar | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} All songs featured in the film except one, are composed by [[G. V. Prakash Kumar]], nephew of noted composer, [[A. R. Rahman]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/music/news/2011/ar-rahman-protege-prakash-joker-070211-aid0017.html |title=Rahman's protege and nephew Prakash to compose for Joker |date=7 February 2011 |publisher=[[Oneindia.in]] |accessdate=1 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120711234709/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/music/news/2011/ar-rahman-protege-prakash-joker-070211-aid0017.html |archivedate=11 July 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The song ''Jugnu Banke Tu'' sung by [[Udit Narayan]] was highly appreciated among all songs. Udit also received Kalakar Award for best male playback singer for this song<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/WATCH-Akshay-Kumar-in-Jugnu-from-Joker/Article1-918674.aspx |title=WATCH: Akshay Kumar in Jugnu from Joker |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140312144752/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/WATCH-Akshay-Kumar-in-Jugnu-from-Joker/Article1-918674.aspx |archivedate=12 March 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The song titled ''I Want Fakth You'' from ''Joker'' was leaked online on 11 July 2012, along with the theatrical trailer which has been composed by [[Gaurav Dagaonkar]]. The song has been acclaimed by the audience, however the song is actually named ''Kaafirana'' and will be released under that title worldwide and also on the soundtrack.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/feb-11-01/gv-prakash-kumar-joker-07-02-11.html |title=GV Prakash goes to Bollywood |publisher=Behind Woods |accessdate=13 February 2011}}</ref>
{{Track listing | headline = Track list | extra_column = Singer(s) | total_length = | all_music = | all_lyrics = Shirish Kunder | title1 = Kafirana | extra1 = [[Sunidhi Chauhan]] & V.Sai Subhankar | note1 = Composed by Gaurav Dagaonkar | length1 = 5:00 | title2 = Jugnu | extra2 = [[Udit Narayan]] | length2 = 4:10 | title3 = Sing Raja | extra3 = [[Daler Mehndi]] & Sonu Kakkar | note3 = | length3 = 3:50 | title4 = Yeh Joker | extra4 = [[Sonu Nigam]] & [[Shweta Pandit]] | length4 = 4:40 | title5 = Tears of Joker | extra5 = Instrumental | length5 = 3:20 | title6 = Alien Arrival | extra6 = Instrumental | length6 = 2:48 }}
===Audio review=== ''Music Aloud'' said: "He may or may not have composed the tunes for the controversy-ridden soundtrack of Jaanemann, but when GV Prakash Kumar actually got to do a credited debut in Bollywood, it turned out to be a rather uninventive one" and rated it 5/10.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.musicaloud.com/2012/07/31/joker-music-review/ |title=Joker – Music Review |date=31 July 2012 |work=Music Aloud |accessdate=1 August 2012}}</ref> ''Score Magazine'', gave it 2 out of 5 stars stating, "You know something is wrong with an album when the instrumental tracks immensely outshine the vocal tracks. I must mention that each of the songs has a strong underlying melody but gross injustice is done to them by Shirish Kunder's lyrics."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.highonscore.com/music-review-joker |title=Music Review – Joker}}</ref>
==Awards== ; [[Kalakar Awards]] * 2013: Best Playback Singer - [[Udit Narayan]] For "Jugnu Banke Tu" ;2013 [[Golden Kela Awards]] * Joker - for worst film * Sonakshi Sinha - for worst actor (female) - nominated * Akshay Kumar - for worst actor (male) - won<ref>http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/news-interviews/Guess-whos-nominated-for-Bollywoods-Golden-Kela-Awards/articleshow/17718721.cms?referral=PM</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.utvgroup.com/motion-pictures/coming-soon/joker.html}} * {{IMDb title|1918886|Joker}} * [http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/cast/id/504775/Joker ''Joker''] at Bollywoodhungama.com

V. Prakash Kumar]] [[Category:Indian comedy films]] [[Category:Indian science fiction films]] [[Category:2010s comedy science fiction films]] [[Category:UTV Motion Pictures films]] [[Category:Films set in fictional populated places]]
