{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Use British English|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox military conflict | partof = the [[Ukrainian crisis]] and the [[Russian military intervention in Ukraine]] | image = [[File:Yani Kapu tugboat attacked by Don patrol boat.png|300px]] | caption = ''Yany Kapu'' tugboat attacked by ''Don'' patrol boat as seen by Ukrainian ''Gyurza-M'' artillery boat | date = 25 November 2018 | place = [[Kerch Strait]] | coordinates = {{coord|44|51|00|N|36|23|04|E|type:waterbody|display=title}} | map_type = Black Sea | map_relief = | map_size = | map_marksize = | map_caption = | map_label = Kerch Strait | status = | result = {{bulleted list|Russian Border Guard captures three Ukrainian naval vessels.|Ukraine declared [[Martial law in Ukraine|regional martial law]] for 30 days starting on 28 November 2018{{cite news|url= https://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/548325.html|title=Poroshenko says martial law to be introduced in Ukraine at 9 a.m. on Nov 28|agency=Interfax-Ukraine|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://www.foxnews.com/world/ukrainian-parliament-votes-to-impose-martial-law-after-russia-allegedly-seized-countrys-ships|title=Ukrainian parliament votes to impose martial law after Russia allegedly seized country's ships|publisher=Fox News Channel|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=27 November 2018}}|Russia closes the Kerch Strait for Ukrainian ships on 28 November 2018{{cite web|url=https://ru.krymr.com/a/news-rossiya-zablokirovala-ukrainskie-porty-v-azovskom-more/29626810.html|title=Россия заблокировала украинские порты на Азовском море. 35 судов в ожидании – Омелян|date=28 November 2018|accessdate=28 November 2018|language=ru}}}} | combatant1 = {{flag|Russia}} | combatant2 = {{flag|Ukraine}} | strength1 = ''10 ships:''
[[Sobol class patrol boat|Sobol patrol boats]]
PS ''Izumrud''
PS ''Don''
''Aircraft:''
2 [[Ka-52]]
2 [[Su-25]]
[[Su-30]] | strength2 = 24 crew
2 [[Gyurza-M-class artillery boat|Gyurza-M artillery boats]] ''Berdiansk'' and ''Nikopol''
1 tugboat ''Yany Kapu'' | casualties1 = 2 ships slightly damaged | casualties2 = 24 crew captured (3 of them injured), 3 ships captured (2 gunboats, 1 tugboat; two of the ships damaged, lost engines){{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46338671|title=Russia seizes Ukrainian naval ships|date=25 November 2018|work=BBC News|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rt.com/news/444853-russia-ukraine-ships-conflict/|title=Russian ships used weapons to stop & seize Ukrainian vessels violating territorial waters – FSB|publisher=RT|date=25 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{cite web|first=Pavlo|last=Kalashnik| url=https://hromadske.ua/posts/rosiya-zahopila-ponad-20-moryakiv-na-zatrimanih-sudnah-predstavnik-prezidenta-v-krimu|title=Росія захопила понад 20 українських моряків — представник президента в Криму|publisher=Hromadske.TV|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018|language=uk}}{{cite web|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/11/ukraine-russia-naval-standoff-crimea-bridge-181125160258144.html|title=Russia seizes Ukrainian ships near annexed Crimea|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}} | casualties3 = | fatalities = | injuries = 2 | arrests = | detentions = | charged = | fined = | casualties_label = | notes = }} {{Campaignbox Ukrainian crisis}} An international incident occurred on 25 November 2018 when Russian [[Federal Security Service]] (FSB) [[Border Service of the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation|border service]] [[Coast Guard (Russia)|coast guard boats]] fired upon and captured three [[Ukrainian Navy]] vessels that had attempted to pass from the [[Black Sea]] into the [[Sea of Azov]] through the [[Kerch Strait]] while on their way to the port of [[Mariupol]].{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-crisis-russia/russia-blocks-ukrainian-navy-from-entering-sea-of-azov-idUSKCN1NU0DL|title=Russia seizes Ukrainian ships near annexed Crimea after firing on them|first1=Andrew|last1=Osborn|first2=Pavel |last2=Polityuk|agency=Reuters|date=25 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}} In 2014, Russia [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|annexed the nearby Crimean Peninsula]], which is internationally recognised as Ukrainian territory, and later constructed the [[Crimean Bridge]] across the strait. Under [[Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Ukraine on cooperation in the use of the sea of Azov and the strait of Kerch|a 2003 treaty]], the strait and the Azov sea are intended to be the shared territorial waters of both countries.{{cite web |title=Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Ukraine on cooperation in the use of the sea of Azov and the strait of Kerch. |url=http://www.fao.org/fishery/shared/faolextrans.jsp?xp_FAOLEX=LEX-FAOC045795&xp_faoLexLang=E&xp_lang=en |website=Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations Database |date=24 December 2003}} As the flotilla, which consisted of two gunboats and a tugboat, approached declared Russian territorial waters enroute the Crimean Strait, the Russian coast guard said they repeatedly asked the Ukrainian vessels to leave what they referred to as "Russian territorial waters", saying that the vessels failed to comply with the formal procedure for passage through the strait, that the Ukrainian ships had been manoeuvring "dangerously", and that they were not responding to radio communications.{{cite news |title=Russian forces fulfilled 'military duty' in stopping Ukraine ships: Putin |url=https://www.nst.com.my/world/2018/11/435456/russian-forces-fulfilled-military-duty-stopping-ukraine-ships-putin |work=New Straits Times}} Ukraine said that it had given advance notice to the Russians that the vessels would be moving through the strait, said that the ships had made radio contact with the Russians, but received no response, and cited the 2003 treaty in asserting freedom of passage through the strait.{{Cite news |url=https://www.defensenews.com/global/europe/2018/11/28/the-sea-of-azov-wont-become-the-new-south-china-sea-and-russia-knows-it/ |title=The Sea of Azov won’t become the new South China Sea (and Russia knows it) |last=Bodner |first=David Larter, Matthew |date=28 November 2018 |work=Defense News |access-date=2 December 2018 |language=en-US}} When the Ukrainian Navy refused to halt their journey, and continued toward the bridge, Russian Coast Guard vessels fired on them and, following a chase, seized the vessels off the coast of Crimea while they were attempting to return to Odessa.{{cite news |title=Russia fires on and seizes Ukrainian ships near annexed Crimea |url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-ukraine-crisis-russia/russia-fires-on-and-seizes-ukrainian-ships-near-annexed-crimea-idUKKCN1NU0DY |agency=Reuters|date=25 November 2018}} Six Ukrainian crew members were injured in the clash, and twenty-four Ukrainian sailors from the captured ships were detained by Russia. The Ukrainian government labelled the incident a potential precursor to a Russian invasion, and declared [[Martial law in Ukraine|martial law]] along the border with Russia and in Black Sea coastal areas.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/11/26/europe/ukraine-russia-kerch-strait-intl/index.html|title=Ukrainian lawmakers approve martial law as tensions with Russia escalate|first1=Nathan|last1=Hodge|first2=Josh |last2=Berlinger|publisher=CNN|date=26 November 2018|access-date=26 November 2018}} The incident took place a few days before the [[2018 G20 Buenos Aires summit]] and was mentioned by Western leaders when they spoke of [[International sanctions during the Ukrainian crisis|sanctions against Russia]]. ==Background== {{Further|Russian military intervention in Ukraine (2014–present)|Crimean Bridge}} Russia [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|annexed Crimea]] in 2014.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46352367|title=Ukraine-Russia clash: MPs back martial law|work=BBC News|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=27 November 2018}} The annexation is [[United Nations General Assembly Resolution 68/262|not officially recognised]] by the United Nations.{{cite web |title=UN Security Council Resolution S/2014/189 |url=http://www.un.org/ga/search/view_doc.asp?symbol=S/2014/189 |publisher=United Nations |accessdate=27 November 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Ingold |first1=David |title=Putin's Stance on Ukraine Supported by Minority of Nations |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/infographics/countries-react-to-russian-intervention-in-crimea.html |publisher=Bloomberg |accessdate=27 November 2018}} The [[Kerch Strait]] connects the [[Sea of Azov]] with the [[Black Sea]], and is formed by the coasts of the Russian [[Taman Peninsula]] and disputed Crimea. It is the point of access for ships travelling to and from Ukraine's eastern port cities, most notably [[Mariupol]]. While both Ukraine and Russia agreed to the principle of freedom of movement through the strait and the Sea of Azov in 2003 following the [[Tuzla Island#2003 dispute|Tuzla Island]] incident,{{Citation|title=Why Did Paul Go West?|url=http://dx.doi.org/10.5040/9781472551061.ch-001|work=Why Did Paul Go West? : Jewish Historical Narrative and Thought|publisher=Bloomsbury T&T Clark|isbn=9780567610379|access-date=27 November 2018}} Russia has controlled both sides of the strait since the Crimean annexation. By May 2018, Russia had completed the construction of the [[Crimean Bridge]], which is {{convert|19|km|mi}} long and spans the strait, providing a direct land connection between Crimea and Moscow.{{cite news |first=Andrew|last=Roth |title=Putin opens 12-mile bridge between Crimea and Russian mainland |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/may/15/putin-opens-bridge-between-crimea-and-russian-mainland |accessdate=26 November 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=15 May 2018}} The bridge's construction was criticised by Ukraine and many other countries, which called it illegal.{{cite news |first=Gleb |last=Stolyarov|title=Trucker Putin opens Russia bridge link with annexed Crimea |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-crisis-crimea-bridge/trucker-putin-opens-russia-bridge-link-with-annexed-crimea-idUSKCN1IG1TH |accessdate=26 November 2018 |agency=Reuters |date=15 May 2018}} The Ukrainian and American governments have said that the bridge is being used by Russia as part of a creeping [[Hybrid warfare|hybrid]] blockade of Ukrainian ports in the Azov Sea, and that Russian inspections of ships have risen sharply since the bridge opened in May 2018, with some being forced to wait between three and seven days before being allowed through.{{cite|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-25/ukraine-complains-russia-uses-crimea-bridge-to-disrupt-shipping |title=Ukraine Complains Russia Is Using New Crimea Bridge to Disrupt Shipping |first1=Kateryna |last1=Choursina |date= 25 July 2018 |publisher=Bloomberg}}{{cite|url=http://maritimebulletin.net/2017/09/10/bulk-carrier-had-to-cut-off-mast-to-pass-under-illegal-kerch-strait-bridge/ |title=Bulk carrier had to cut off mast to pass under illegal Kerch Strait Bridge |first1=Andrey |last1=Klimenko |date=18 September 2018|publisher=The Maritime Executive }}[https://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/article-putins-bridge-over-troubled-waters/ Putin’s bridge over troubled waters], ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' (26 October 2018)[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46345853 Why Ukraine-Russia sea clash is fraught with risk], [[BBC News]] (27 November 2018) On 23 September 2018, two Ukrainian navy vessels successfully completed the journey from [[Odessa]] to [[Mariupol]] through the strait. According to Ukrainian Navy Captain 1st rank Dmytro Kovalenko, they had passed the Crimean Bridge without officially requesting permission. They did, however, announce their intent to pass through and received navigational pilot services free of charge. https://ru.krymr.com/a/proryv-ukrainskih-korabley-cherez-kerchenskiy-proliv/29508318.html He also claimed that during their journey they had been followed by at least 13 Russian vessels and that Russian aircraft had flown dangerously low over them. ==Events== [[File:Новозбудовані для українських ВМС малі броньовані артилерійські катери в ході випробувань здійснили спільне плавання (27359525951).jpg|thumb|left|A [[Gyurza-M-class artillery boat]] ''BK-02 Berdyansk''. One of the gun boats captured by the [[Federal Security Service]]]] ===The incident=== The incident began in the morning of 25 November, when the Ukrainian {{sclass-|Gyurza-M|artillery boat|1}}s ''{{ill|Berdyansk (ship)|uk|Бердянськ (артилерійський катер)|lt=Berdyansk}}'', ''{{ill|Nikopol (ship)|uk|Нікополь (артилерійський катер)|lt=Nikopol}}'', and tugboat ''{{ill|Yany Kapu (tugboat)|uk|Яни Капу (буксир)|lt=Yany Kapu}}'' were transiting from the [[Black Sea]] port of [[Odessa]] in south-western Ukraine with the intent of reaching the [[Azov Sea]] port of [[Mariupol]] in [[eastern Ukraine]]. Agents of the Ukrainian [[Security Service of Ukraine|SBU]] intelligence service were present onboard the ships.{{cite news |title=Russia shrugs off Western pressure over Black Sea incident with Ukraine |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/russia-shrugs-off-western-pressure-over-black-sea-incident-with-ukraine/2018/11/27/308a2df0-f245-11e8-99c2-cfca6fcf610c_story.html|work=Washington Post |language=en}} As they approached the [[Kerch Strait]], Russian [[Coast Guard (Russia)|coast guards]] boats accused the Ukrainian ships of illegally entering Russian [[territorial waters]], and ordered them to leave. When the Ukrainians refused, citing the [[Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Ukraine on cooperation in the use of the sea of Azov and the strait of Kerch|2003 Russo-Ukrainian treaty]] on freedom of navigation in the relevant area, the Russian boats attempted to intercept them, and rammed ''Yany Kapu''. The Ukrainian vessels continued toward the [[Crimean Bridge]], but were prevented passage into the [[Sea of Azov]] by a large tanker positioned under it, which blocked all passage through the strait.{{cite web |url=https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2018/11/25/7199222/ |title=Росія перекрила прохід цивільних суден через Керченську протоку |date=25 November 2018 |work=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]] |access-date=25 November 2018|language=uk}} Concurrently, Russia scrambled two fighter jets and two helicopters to patrol the strait. The Russian forces then fired on the Ukrainian boats, chased them as they tried to flee back to Odessa, and later captured them about {{convert|23|km}} off the coast of Crimea, in [[international waters]].{{cite news |url=https://www.unian.ua/war/10352406-u-merezhi-pokazali-koordinati-miscya-ataki-rosiyanami-ukrajinskih-kateriv-foto.html |title=У мережі показали координати місця атаки росіянами українських катерів |author= |date=26 November 2018 |website=unian.ua |agency=[[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency]] |access-date=28 November 2018 }} ===Damage and political response=== [[File:Berdyansk damaged gunboat.jpg|thumb|upright|Captured ''BK-02 Berdyansk'' with a hole in the pilothouse]] Following the incident, the Ukrainian Navy reported that six servicemen had been injured by the Russian actions. ''Berdyansk'' was damaged in her bridge, either by a [[Sukhoi Su-30]] fighter{{Cite news|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/photos-show-damaged-ukrainian-artillery-boat-that-russia-fired-upon#a-russian-weapon-blew-a-window-sized-hole-in-the-artillery-boats-pilothouse-where-crewmembers-steer-the-boat-it-appears-to-have-been-hit-by-a-30mm-gun-from-a-russian-warship-or-a-weapon-fired-from-a-su-30-russian-fighter-jet-1|title=New pictures show exactly how severely Russia damaged a Ukrainian boat and set off a crisis in the Black Sea|work=Business Insider|access-date=28 November 2018}} or by 30 mm naval gunfire from the Russian gunboat ''Izumrud'', according to the Russian version.{{cite web|url=http://www.fsb.ru/fsb/press/message/single.htm!id=10438315@fsbMessage.html|title=Подробная информация :: Федеральная Служба Безопасности|website=fsb.ru|access-date=29 November 2018}} According to radio communication between the Russian leadership and border guard ships, two Russian ships were damaged.{{Citation|last=Генеральний штаб ЗСУ|title=Radio communication between the Russian leadership and border guard ships|date=26 November 2018|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xpdlGAweVu4|access-date=29 November 2018}} One was damaged while ramming the Ukrainian tugboat ''Yany Kapu''.{{cite web |url=https://mil.in.ua/захоплених-українських-моряків-етап/ |title=Захоплених українських моряків етапували в Керч |date=26 November 2018 |website=mil.in.ua |publisher=[[Ukrainian Military Portal]] |access-date=26 November 2018 |language=uk}}{{cite web |url=https://ukr.segodnya.ua/ukraine/vo-vremya-konflikta-v-azovskom-more-postradal-rossiyskiy-korabl-1192050.html |title=Під час конфлікту в Азовському морі пошкоджений російський корабель |date=25 November 2018 |work=[[Segodnya]] |access-date=25 November 2018 |language=uk}}{{cite web |url=https://dumskaya.net/news/rossiyskiy-pogranichnyy-korabl-taranil-buksir-vm-092666/ |title=Российский пограничный корабль таранил буксир ВМС Украины и получил пробоину|trans-title=Russian border ship rammed a tug of the Ukrainian Navy and got a hole |date=25 November 2018 |website=''Dumskaya.net'' |accessdate=26 November 2018|language=ru}} In addition, the Russian ship ''Don'' also collided with and damaged the Russian ship ''Izumrud''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.unian.info/war/10353855-ukraine-intercepts-radio-comms-of-russian-coast-guards-with-command-amid-attack-on-ukraine-navy-boats-transcript.html|title=Ukraine intercepts radio comms of Russian coast guards with Command amid attack on Ukraine Navy boats (Transcript)|date=27 November 2018|agency=Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|access-date=27 November 2018}} In the aftermath of the incident, officials from both countries accused the other of provocative behaviour.{{cite web|url=https://www.rferl.org/a/ukrainian-lawmakers-to-consider-martial-law-proposal-after-russia-opens-fire-on-ships-in-black-sea/29620128.html|title=Ukraine Considering Martial Law After Russia Opens Fire On Black Sea Ships|publisher=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|date=26 November 2018|access-date=26 November 2018}} Ukraine decried the seizure of its ships as illegal.[https://www.unian.info/m/politics/10351089-russia-s-don-coast-guard-ship-rams-ukrainian-tugboat-amid-transfer-from-odesa-to-mariupol-video.html Russia's 'Don' coast guard ship rams Ukrainian tugboat amid transfer from Odesa to Mariupol (video)], [[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency]] (25 November 2018){{cite news|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2018/11/ukraine-russia-naval-standoff-crimea-bridge-181125160258144.html|title=Russia accused of firing on Ukrainian ship in naval standoff|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=25 November 2018|accessdate=25 November 2018}} In a statement, the Ukrainian Navy said, "After leaving the 12-mile zone, the Russian Federation's FSB opened fire at the flotilla belonging to... the armed forces of Ukraine". Ukrainian president [[Petro Poroshenko]] convened the Ukrainian [[National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine|National Security and Defence Council]], describing the Russian actions as "unprovoked and crazy". Russia did not immediately or directly respond to the allegation, but Russian news agencies cited the [[Federal Security Service]] (FSB) as saying it had incontrovertible proof that Ukraine had orchestrated what it called a "provocation" and would publicise its evidence soon.{{cite web |url=https://espreso.tv/news/2018/11/25/poroshenko_sklykav_voyennyy_kabinet_na_2200_cherez_agresiyu_rosiyi_na_mori |title=Порошенко скликав воєнний кабінет на 22:00 через агресію Росії на морі |date=25 November 2018 |publisher=[[Espreso TV]] |access-date=25 November 2018 |language=uk}} A report by the Russian FSB said that Ukraine had not followed the official procedure required for passage through the strait, namely that the port authority in [[Kerch]] should be informed 48 and 24 hours in advance of any movement, with an official confirmation 4 hours before the passage.{{cite web |authorlink1=Federal Security Service |title=О провокационных действиях кораблей ВМС Украины |url=http://www.fsb.ru/fsb/press/message/single.htm!id%3D10438315%40fsbMessage.html |website=Федеральная Служба Безопасности |publisher=Russian Federal Security Service |accessdate=28 November 2018 |language=Russian}} It also said the Ukrainian ships had been manoeuvring dangerously and intentionally ignored FSB instructions in order to stir up tensions. Russian politicians, including President [[Vladimir Putin]], denounced the Ukrainian government, saying the incident was a calculated attempt by Ukrainian president Petro Poroshenko to increase his popularity ahead of the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2019|Ukrainian presidential election next year]].{{cite news|first=Matthew|last=Bodner|url= https://www.apnews.com/b9e44a0c2dce40aebfc117e1490c51b9 |title=Russia fires on Ukrainian vessels in Black Sea; 2 wounded|date=25 November 2018|agency=Associated Press|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46370619 |title=Sea clash staged by Ukraine, says Putin |date=28 November 2018 |work=BBC News|access-date=28 November 2018 }} The Ukrainian government rejected this, and said it had informed the Russians of the planned passage through the Kerch Strait in advance. Ukrainian Navy spokesman Oleh Chalyk said that ''Yany Kapu'' had "established contact with a coast-guard outpost" operated by the FSB Border Service and "communicated its intention to sail through the Kerch Strait. The information was received [by Russian authorities] but no response was given".{{Cite news |url=https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-russian-ship-rams-navy-tugboat-off-crimea-azov/29619665.html |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty|title=Kyiv Says Russia Attacked Ukrainian Navy Ships, Seized Three In Black Sea |access-date=2 December 2018 |language=en}} According to Ukraine, contact was established at 03:58 on 25 November, "according to international rules of the sea navigation safety".[https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-defense/2587124-russia-escalates-conflict-in-the-kerch-strait-chronology-of-events.html Russia escalates conflict in the Kerch Strait: chronology of events], [[Ukrinform]] (25 November 2018) In late September 2018, two Ukrainian navy vessels successfully made the journey from Odessa to Mariupol not using current Russian official procedure, but also contact was established a few hours before the passage.[https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-defense/2551703-dmytro-kovalenko-commander-of-the-ukrainian-navy-move-to-azov-sea.html Dmytro Kovalenko, commander of the Ukrainian Navy move to Azov Sea], [[Ukrinform]] (4 October 2018) ===Aftermath=== On the morning of 26 November, photographs of the captured Ukrainian ships laid up in the Crimean port of [[Kerch]] were published. In the photos, small camouflage nets cover the ships' bows.{{cite web |url=https://www.ukrmilitary.com/2018/11/photo-mbaks-and-tugboat.html |title=Фото захоплених українських кораблів у Керчі |date=26 November 2018 |website=''ukrmilitary.com'' |publisher=[[Ukrainian Military Pages]] |access-date=27 November 2018 |language=uk}} On that day, according to APK-Inform, Ukrainian commercial shipping returned to normal operation after the Kerch Strait was reopened to civilian traffic.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-crisis-russia-grains/ukraines-azov-sea-ports-operating-normally-despite-tensions-with-russia-idUSKCN1NV151|title=Ukraine's Azov Sea ports operating normally despite tensions with Russia|agency=Reuters|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://tass.com/world/1032467|title=Passage through Kerch Strait open for civilian vessels after Ukraine standoff|agency=TASS|date=26 November 2018}} According to Ukrainian intelligence, the state of health of the Ukrainian Naval Forces servicemen who were injured in the attack in the Kerch Strait is satisfactory. The injured Ukrainian sailors were being treated at Pirogov Kerch City Hospital No. 1.{{cite news |url=https://www.ukrinform.ua/rubric-ato/2587735-troh-poranenih-ukrainskih-morakiv-prooperuvali-u-kerci-rozvidka.html |title=Трьох поранених українських моряків прооперували у Керчі - розвідка |date=26 November 2018 |agency=[[Ukrinform]] |access-date=26 November 2018 |language=uk}} Other photographs showed significant damage inflicted to the Berdyansk gunboat, including a hole in the [[Bridge (nautical)|bridge]], where crewmembers steer the boat. According to Vasyl Hrytsak, the head of Ukraine's security service, two missiles were fired by one of the Russian strike aircraft.{{cite news |last1=Brown |first1=Daniel |title=A Russian weapon blew a window-sized hole in the artillery boat’s pilothouse, where crew members steer the boat. It also had some minor holes in other places. It appears to have been hit by a 30mm gun from a Russian warship or a weapon fired from a Su-30 Russian fighter jet. |url=https://www.businessinsider.com.au/photos-show-damaged-ukrainian-artillery-boat-that-russia-fired-upon-2018-11 |accessdate=30 November 2018 |work=Business Insider |date=29 November 2018}} On 27 November, a Crimean court ordered that 12 of the 24 Ukrainian sailors be detained for 60 days.[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46356111 Ukraine-Russia sea clash: Captured sailors shown on Russia TV], [[BBC News]] (27 November 2018) The following day the 12 remaining Ukrainian sailors, including the three hospitalised, were also officially detained for 60 days by the [[Kievskiy Raion]] court of [[Simferopol]].{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2018/11/28/7199611/ The invaders arrested all captured Ukrainian sailors], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (28 November 2018) On 29 November, Russian authorities stated that the three hospitalised sailors were discharged from hospital.{{uk icon}} [https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2018/11/29/7199703/ In Crimea, it was stated that they were discharged from the hospital three wounded sailors], [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (29 November 2018) On the evening of 28 November, Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister [[Volodymyr Omelyan]] said that vessels bound for the ports of Berdyansk and Mariupol awaited entrance to the Sea of Azov and vessels were also waiting to go southbound. He characterised this as a virtual blockade. No vessels were identified as Ukrainian. ==Reactions== ===Ukraine=== [[File:Martial Law in Ukraine (2018).svg|thumb|left|Martial law in Ukraine]] {{main|Martial law in Ukraine}} Ukrainian president [[Petro Poroshenko]] convened the [[National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine]] on 25 November. He warned of the threat of a Russian land invasion.{{cite news |last1=Osborn |first1=Andrew |title=Ukraine introduces martial law citing threat of Russian invasion |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-crisis-russia/ukraine-introduces-martial-law-citing-threat-of-russian-invasion-idUSKCN1NV0N1 |accessdate=27 November 2018 |agency=Reuters |date=26 November 2018}} [[Oleksandr Turchynov]], Secretary of the National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine, reportedly said that the incident was an act of war by Russia.{{cite web |url=https://zik.ua/news/2018/11/26/turchynov_na_zasidanni_rnbo_zaproponuvav_vvesty_voiennyy_stan_na_60_dib_1455775 |title=Турчинов: РФ вперше відкрито атакувала Збройні сили України |date=26 November 2018 |website=ZIK.ua |access-date=26 November 2018 |language=uk}} He has also stated that active military preparations had been spotted along the border on the Russian side.{{cite news|url=https://www.unian.ua/politics/10351728-turchinov-zayaviv-pro-aktivnu-pidgotovku-viyskovih-pidrozdiliv-rf-na-kordonah-z-ukrajinoyu.html |title=Турчинов заявив про активну підготовку військових підрозділів РФ на кордонах з Україною |agency=[[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency]] |date=26 November 2018|access-date=26 November 2018|language=uk}} The [[National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine]], in its decision of 26 November, stated{{cite web|url=http://zakon.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/n0012525-18#n8|title=Щодо надзвичайних заходів із забезпечення державного суверенітету і незалежності України та введення воєнного стану в Україні|accessdate=30 November 2018}} that the actions of the Russian Federation against the ships of the [[Ukrainian Navy|Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine]] fall under paragraphs "c" and "d" of Art. 3 of [[United Nations General Assembly Resolution 3314|Resolution 3314 (XXIX)]] “Definition of aggression”, adopted by the UN General Assembly on 14 December 1974, namely: * the blockade of the ports or coasts of a State by the armed forces of another State; * an attack by the armed forces of a State on the land, sea or air forces, or marine and air fleets of another State.{{cite web|url=http://hrlibrary.umn.edu/instree/GAres3314.html|title=United Nations General Assembly Resolution 3314 (XXIX)|website=hrlibrary.umn.edu|accessdate=30 November 2018}} On 26 November 2018, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine held a briefing, where they announced that they viewed the actions of the Russian Federation during the incident as an act of armed aggression in violation of a number of international norms and treaties, including: the [[Agreement between the Russian Federation and the Ukraine on cooperation in the use of the sea of Azov and the strait of Kerch|Agreement between Ukraine and the Russian Federation on cooperation in the use of the Azov Sea and the Kerch Strait]], article 17 of the [[United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea]], part 1 of article 36 of the UN Convention, articles 32 and 95 of the United Nations Convention, article 30 of the UN Convention, and article 2 of the [[UN Charter]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mil.gov.ua/news/2018/11/26/normi-mizhnarodnogo-prava-ta-naczionalnogo-zakonodavstva-dayut-pidstavi-klasifikuvati-dii-rf-yak-akt-zbrojnoi-agresii-%E2%80%93-general-major-radion-timoshenko/|title=Норми міжнародного права та національного законодавства дають підстави класифікувати дії РФ як акт збройної агресії, – генерал-майор Радіон Тимошенко|website=Міністерство оборони України|access-date=28 November 2018}} On 26 November, a day after the incident, lawmakers in the [[Verkhovna Rada|Ukrainian Parliament]] overwhelmingly backed the imposition of [[Martial law in Ukraine|martial law]] in the country's coastal regions, and those bordering Russia and unrecognised [[Transnistria|Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic]]. A total of 276 members of parliament voted for the measure, which took effect on 28 November 2018,{{Cite news|url=https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2018/11/27/7199520/|title=Воєнний стан діятиме до 26 грудня – Порошенко|date=27 November 2018|work=Українська Правда}} and automatically expires in 30 days.{{Cite news|first=Tom|last=Embury-Dennis|url= https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/russia-ukraine-live-latest-update-martial-law-black-sea-ships-navy-crisis-a8651736.html|title=Kiev declares martial law after Russian seizure of Ukrainian ships in Black Sea|work=The Independent|date=26 November 2018|access-date=26 November 2018}} The initial recommendation was for a 60-day enforcement; according to Poroshenko it was amended so not to affect the upcoming elections.{{cite news |title=Ukraine backs martial law after sea clash |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-46352367 |accessdate=27 November 2018 |work=BBC News|date=27 November 2018}} On 28 November 2018, Ukrainian President Poroshenko said that the incident was provoked by Russia in order to force Ukraine to declare martial law and therefore to prevent Ukraine from receiving its ''tomos'' of [[autocephaly]] for the [[Ukrainian Orthodox Church]] (see: [[2018 Moscow–Constantinople schism]]).{{Cite news|url=https://www.unian.info/politics/10356345-poroshenko-explains-timing-of-russia-s-attack-on-ukrainian-ships-near-kerch-strait.html|title=Poroshenko explains timing of Russia's attack on Ukrainian ships near Kerch Strait|date=28 November 2018|agency=Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|access-date=28 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://espreso.tv/news/2018/11/28/poroshenko_skazav_chomu_putin_napav_v_kerchenskiy_protoci_same_zaraz|title=Порошенко сказав, чому Путін напав в Керченській протоці саме зараз|date=28 November 2018|website=espreso.tv|dead-url=|access-date=28 November 2018}} Vice Admiral [[Ihor Voronchenko]] said on 29 November that Ukraine would request the closure of the [[Bosphorus|Bosphorus Strait]].{{cite web|url=https://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/549290.html|title=Ukraine will call for closing Bosphorus Strait for Russian navy because of Kerch Strait incident – Voronchenko|accessdate=30 November 2018}} President Poroshenko during an interview told the German tabloid ''[[Bild]]'' that Germany should support Ukraine.{{cite web |title=Ukraine's leader asks Nato to send ships |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-46381166 |work=BBC News|date=29 November 2018}} Poroshenko also told ''Bild'' that Putin saw Ukraine as a Russian colony.{{cite web |title=Ukrainian leader says Putin wants his whole country, asks for NATO help |url=https://www.haaretz.com/world-news/ukraine-calling-on-nato-to-deploy-ships-to-site-of-ongoing-standoff-with-russia-1.6699524 |website=Haaretz}} On 30 November, Ukraine banned all Russian men between 16 and 60 from entering the country, claiming this is a security measure. It was reported that Russian women were denied entry as well.{{cite news |last1=Roth |first1=Andrew |title=Ukraine bans entry to Russian men ‘to prevent armies forming’ |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/30/ukraine-bans-russian-men-from-entering-the-country |accessdate=30 November 2018 |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=30 November 2018}} ===Russia=== Russia's FSB blamed Ukraine for sparking the clashes, saying their "irrefutable" evidence "will soon be made public".{{cite web|url=https://www.euronews.com/2018/11/25/ukraine-slams-russian-aggression-after-boat-is-rammed-in-sea-standoff|title=Ukrainian president summons war cabinet after Russia 'fires on ships'|date=25 November 2018|publisher=Euronews|accessdate=26 November 2018}} On 26 November, the FSB published its detailed chronology of the events of 25 November on its website.[http://www.fsb.ru/fsb/press/message/single.htm ]{{dead link|date=December 2018}} The chronology indicated that the Ukrainian vessels failed to follow the advance notification procedures for passage through the Kerch Strait and that Russia did not contest the 2003 Treaty right to freedom of navigation through the strait. Foreign Minister [[Sergey Lavrov]] said on the next day that Ukraine had violated international legal norms by failing to obtain authorisation for its vessels. [[List of Deputy Chairmen of the State Duma|Deputy Chairman]] of the [[State Duma]] [[Pyotr Olegovich Tolstoy|Pyotr Tolstoy]] warned of the danger of a war.{{cite news|url=https://www.thejournal.ie/russia-ukraine-sea-of-azov-4359513-Nov2018/|title='Unleashing conflict': Ukraine says Russia opened fire on navy ships|agency=Agence France-Presse|via=thejournal.ie|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}} Following the declaration of martial law in Ukraine, Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] expressed "serious concern". He later called the event "a provocation" and accused Ukraine's President of staging the incident in order to improve his popularity ahead of the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2019|2019 presidential election]]. According to the state-run [[RIA Novosti]], Russia's military planned to send additional [[S-400 missile system|S-400 ''Triumf'']] missile batteries to Crimea.{{cite web |last1=Chappell |first1=Bill |title=Russia Plans To Deploy More S-400 Missiles To Disputed Crimea Peninsula |url=https://www.npr.org/2018/11/28/671466911/russia-plans-to-deploy-more-s-400-missiles-to-disputed-crimea-peninsula |publisher=NPR |accessdate=29 November 2018 |date=28 November 2018}} ===United Nations=== On 26 November, Russia called for an emergency meeting of the [[United Nations Security Council]] (UNSC).{{cite news|url=http://tass.com/politics/1032461|title=Russia asks for convening UN SC meeting on Sea of Azov situation|agency=TASS|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}} The agenda of that UNSC session, on what Russia described as the "violation" of its borders by the Ukrainian navy, was dismissed by seven votes to four, with four abstentions. Russia's first deputy [[Permanent Representative of Russia to the United Nations#Permanent Representatives of the Russian Federation to the United Nations|ambassador to the UN]], Dmitry Polyanski, said that Russia, being a [[Permanent members of the United Nations Security Council#Current permanent members|permanent member of the Security Council]], would continue to raise important issues "under the agenda they relate to."{{cite news|url=http://tass.com/world/1032725|title=UN Security Council refuses to adopt Russia’s agenda for emergency session|agency=TASS|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}} Ukraine also called for an emergency meeting of the UNSC over the "attack" of Russia.{{cite web|url=https://www.radiosvoboda.org/a/news-korabel-taran-oon/29619959.html|title=Україна звернулася до Ради безпеки ООН через напад російських кораблів на українські|date=25 November 2018|publisher=[[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]]|language=uk|accessdate=26 November 2018}} This was confirmed by [[United States Ambassador to the United Nations|US Ambassador to the UN]] [[Nikki Haley]].{{cite web|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/418168-haley-un-security-council-to-hold-emergency-meeting-on-ukraine-russia|title=Haley: UN Security Council to hold emergency meeting on Ukraine-Russia tensions|first=Brandon|last=Conradis|date=25 November 2018|work=The Hill|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{cite news|url=http://time.com/5462996/russia-ukraine-u-n-security-council-emergency-meeting-called/|title=The U.N. Security Council Is Calling an Emergency Meeting Over Russia-Ukraine Tensions|work=Time|date=26 November 2018|access-date=27 November 2018}} Haley said that Russia's actions were an "outrageous violation" of Ukraine's territory. She demanded that Russia stop its "unlawful conduct" and respect the "navigational rights and freedoms of all states."{{cite news|first1=Emily|last1=Sullivan|first2=Bill|last2=Chappell|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/11/26/670746252/ukraine-considers-martial-law-after-russia-seizes-its-ships-near-crimea?t=1543254273384|title=Russia's Seizure Of Ukrainian Ships Is An 'Outrageous Violation,' Haley Says At U.N.|publisher=NPR|date=26 November 2018|access-date=27 November 2018}} [[Permanent Representative of the United Kingdom to the United Nations|U.K. Ambassador]] [[Karen Pierce|Karen Pierce]] condemned Russia's "deplorable" military action.{{cite news|last=Embury-Dennis |first=Tom|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/russia-ukraine-live-latest-update-martial-law-black-sea-ships-navy-crisis-a8651736.html|title=Russia-Ukraine crisis: Kiev declares martial law as world powers condemn the seizure of ships by Putin's forces near Crimea|work=The Independent|date=27 November 2018|access-date=27 November 2018}} [[Under-Secretary-General of the United Nations|U.N. Under-Secretary-General]] for [[United Nations Department of Political Affairs|Political Affairs]] [[Rosemary DiCarlo]] said the United Nations was not able to verify the events independently.{{cite web|url=http://news.trust.org//item/20181126172125-uph87/|title=At U.N., U.S. warns Russia over 'outrageous' violation of Ukraine sovereignty|first=Michelle |last=Nichols|publisher=Thomson Reuters Foundation News|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=26 November 2018}} On 27 November, Secretary-General [[António Guterres]], expressed in a statement that he was "greatly concerned" about the incident and urges Russia and Ukraine to use "maximum restraint" and "to reduce tensions through all available peaceful means in accordance with the Charter of the UN".{{cite web|url=https://bulgarianmilitary.com/2018/11/27/kerch-strait-incident-resulted-in-court-orders-and-international-criticism/|title=Kerch Strait Incident Resulted in Court Orders and International Criticism|website=''bulgarianmilitary.com''|accessdate=30 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rte.ie/news/world/2018/1127/1013658-russia-ukraine/|title=UN 'greatly concerned' over Russia-Ukraine conflict|date=27 November 2018|accessdate=30 November 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.timesnownews.com/international/article/united-nations-chief-antonio-guterres-urges-maximum-restraint-from-russia-ukraine/321996|title=United Nations chief Antonio Guterres urges 'maximum restraint' from Russia, Ukraine|publisher=Times Now|date=27 November 2018|accessdate=3 December 2018}} ===Other countries and organisations=== The [[Council of Europe]] urged deescalation,{{cite web |title=Poroshenko: We must put pressure on Russia to bring it back to civilized world since it is a threat to global security |url=https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-polytics/2591428-poroshenko-we-must-put-pressure-on-russia-to-bring-it-back-to-civilized-world-since-it-is-a-threat-to-global-security.html |website=''ukrinform.net'' }} as did the [[European Union]],{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/latest-ukraine-russia-opens-fire-ukrainian-vessels-59405716|title=The Latest: EU calls for restraint from Russia, Ukraine|date=26 November 2018|publisher=ABC News|accessdate=26 November 2018}} Spain Bolivia,{{cite web|url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2018/11/1026601|title=UN urges Russia and Ukraine to step away from further confrontation at sea|date=26 November 2018|accessdate=27 November 2018}} China{{cite web|url=https://www.rt.com/news/444904-international-reaction-crimea-standoff/|title=Germany, China seek to defuse Kerch Strait tensions, as Austria worries over impact on Ukraine vote|publisher=RT|date=26 November 2018|access-date=27 November 2018}} Japan,{{cite web |title=Tokyo avoids criticizing Moscow over Ukraine issue ahead of talks on Russian-held islands off Hokkaido |url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2018/11/28/national/politics-diplomacy/tokyo-avoids-criticizing-moscow-ukraine-issue-ahead-talks-russian-held-islands-off-hokkaido/ |website=Japan Times |date=28 November 2018}} and [[NATO]].{{cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/25/russia-border-guards-ram-tugboat-ukraine-navy-crimea|title=Ukraine president proposes martial law after Russia's ship seizure|first=Patrick|last=Greenfield|date=25 November 2018|website=The Guardian|accessdate=26 November 2018}} The [[President of the European Council]] [[Donald Tusk]] condemned the Russian use of force.{{cite web |url=https://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/global-community-responds-russia-firing-ukraine-nato-eu |title=Global Community Responds Russia Firing On Ukraine: NATO, EU Condemn Force |author= |date=26 November 2018 |website=Talking Points Memo |access-date=26 November 2018}} Australia,{{cite news|url=https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-polytics/2587598-australia-calls-on-russia-to-restore-navigation-rights-at-kerch-strait-embassy.html |title=Australia calls on Russia to restore navigation rights at Kerch Strait – embassy |date=26 November 2018 |agency=[[Ukrinform]] |access-date=26 November 2018}} Canada,{{cite news |url=https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-polytics/2587390-canada-calls-on-russia-to-resume-maritime-traffic-in-sea-of-azov.html |title=Canada calls on Russia to resume maritime traffic in Sea of Azov |date=26 November 2018 |agency=[[Ukrinform]] |access-date=26 November 2018}} the [[Czech Republic]],{{cite web |title=Ministry of Foreign Affairs condemns the use of force at the Kerch Strait United States President [[Donald Trump]] canceled the planned meeting with the president of Russia [[Vladimir Putin]] during the [[2018 G20 Buenos Aires summit|G-20]] summit, claiming that the sole reason was the situation with Ukrainian ships and sailors.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/11/28/donald-trump-may-cancel-putin-meeting-russias-seizure-ships/|title=Donald Trump may cancel Putin meeting over Russia's seizure of ships in Crimea|work=The Telegraph|date=28 November 2018|accessdate=28 November 2018}}{{cite news |last1=Landler |first1=Mark |last2=Baker |first2=Peter |title=Dodging Friends, Chased by Legal Troubles, Trump Navigates G-20 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/30/world/americas/trump-g20-putin-prince.html |accessdate=3 December 2018 |work=The New York Times |date=30 November 2018}} ==Order of battle== ===Russia=== * Minesweeper ''Vice-admiral Zakharyin'', project 02668Kirill Bulanov, Aleksei Nikolskiy, Irina Chevtayeva. colspan="11" style="background:white;"|Total casualties: 3 wounded, 24 captured (including wounded) |} ==See also== *[[1986 Black Sea incident]] *[[1988 Black Sea bumping incident]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Commonscat|2018 Kerch Strait incident}} * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xpdlGAweVu4 Radio communication between the Russian leadership and border guard ships] // [[General Staff of the Ukrainian Armed Forces]] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gcTSDaCg5xA Таран у Керченского моста / Ramming at the Kerch Bridge] {{2018 shipwrecks}} {{Ukrainian crisis navbox}} {{Political scandals in Ukraine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kerch Strait incident}} [[Category:2018 in Russia]] [[Category:2018 in Ukraine]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2018]] [[Category:Cold War II]] [[Category:International maritime incidents]] [[Category:Kerch Strait]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in 2018]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in Russia]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in Ukraine]] [[Category:Military history of Russia]] [[Category:Military history of Ukraine]] [[Category:Military history of the Black Sea]] [[Category:November 2018 events in Europe]] [[Category:Russia–Ukraine military relations]] [[Category:Sea of Azov]] [[Category:Ukrainian crisis]] [[Category:Political scandals in Ukraine]] [[Category:Naval battles post-1945]]
